entry.title: [Files]: Add ability for RecentModel to limit wait for results.
entry.content:
In the current implementation RecentModel can wait indefinitely for a

response from any given RecentSource. While this is perfectly fine

solution for local sources, it may become problematic especially for

volumes that represent cloud based file systems. In this CL we add the

ability to set and clear the scan timeout. If set, it puts a hard limit

by which sources have to respond to have their results included in the

response to GetRecentFiles call. By default the limit is not set, to make the RecentModel behave as it was before this CL.



Bug: b:244395002

Change-Id: I4de90977e7c377a8b130faacdb79bb608d8f9f63

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4821287

Reviewed-by: Peter Marshall

Commit-Queue: Bo Majewski

entry.title: CCA: Flatten CCA initialization in main.ts
entry.content:
The current CCA initialization flow consist of three parts:

* In the module level (async () => {})().

* In the App constructor.

* In the App.start.



This makes it a bit harder to follow the overall initialization order.



Flattern all initialization into a "main" function instead of having a

App class, and change the necessary member variables to local variables.



This CL is merely a mechanical rewrite and subsequent CL will focus on

cleanup the initialization order.



BUG=None

TEST=cca.py tsc

TEST=tast run camera.CCAUIStress* camera.CCAUISmoke*

entry.title: [BRP] Use universal references in raw_ptr_cast.h
entry.content:
We need to use it to support cast of references.

This CL fixes following casts:



struct MyInt {

int val;

};

struct DerivedInt : MyInt {};

void f(DerivedInt& ref) {

(void) unsafe_raw_ptr_static_cast(ref); // Fixed UB

(void) unsafe_raw_ptr_reinterpret_cast(ref); // Fixed UB

}



Prior to this CL, |Source| template type argument was deduced as

|DerivedInt|, not |DerivedInt&|. That makes |unsafe_raw_ptr_***_cast| to

return a reference to stack-allocated function argument and its usage is

UB.



Bug: 1475895

Change-Id: Iec0e607bac8e37c08df9b92eb78d31e7f4d3fc4e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4812134

Commit-Queue: Mikihito Matsuura

Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1189925}

entry.title: avif_image_decoder: Always use RGBA for half float
entry.content:
When decoding to half float, the pixel ordering is always RGBA and

does not change depending on the platform (unlike 8-bit, where

Android uses a different pixel ordering than other platforms).



This CL fixes a bug where high bitdepth images are rendered

incorrectly when decode_to_half_float_ is set to true.



Test: newly added unit tests pass (they fail without this CL).

Bug: 1476458

entry.title: OptGuide Model Executor: Add an explicit flag to preload the model
entry.content:
For use cases where the model should not be preloaded, but the caller wishes to use custom logic for calling `UnloadModel`, this additional flag is needed.



This CL should address a detected memory leak in BrowsingTopics where the model (several MBs) is sitting unused in memory most of the time because it does use custom model unloading logic, but does not need the model to be preloaded. (Detected memory leak as in the unused allocation is being flagged as a leak but is never actually leaked in the sense of something like unique_ptr.release()).



Callers who wish to have a tflite model available at anytime without needing to be loaded from disk should set `SetShouldUnloadModelOnComplete(false)` and `SetShouldPreloadModel(true)`.



BUG=1421496,1403525



Change-Id: I285b9a8dee823e1f6dc2a2383d4493ab13e7d3a0

entry.title: [BRP/clang-plugin] No raw_ptr enforcement to ptrs in STACK_ALLOCATED()
entry.content:
- raw_ptr usage on-stack context (e.g. function parameter) is

optional and not enforced.

Member fields in STACK_ALLOCATED() objects are known to be always

on-stack, so we should not enforce raw_ptr usage there.

This CL will exclude there from enforcement.

- This CL is effective only if `check-raw-ptr-to-stack-allocated` is

activated. It is not enabled yet.



Note:

raw_ptr pointing to STACK_ALLOCATED() is already excluded from

enforcement. https://crrev.com/c/4542127

This CL adds exclusion for raw_ptr as a member of

STACK_ALLOCATED() struct/class.



struct Foo {

STACK_ALLOCATED();

raw_ptr ptr1; // OK, but not recommended

int* ptr2; // Allowed by crrev.com/c/4800771 (this CL)

}

struct Bar {

raw_ptr ptr1; // Disallowed by crrev.com/c/4542127

Foo* ptr2; // Allowed by crrev.com/c/4542127

}



Change-Id: I41bfe1d0b1289420dbaa479180b0d8e8023b35a5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4800771

entry.title: Move tab search input into the main component
entry.content:
The wrapper for the text search is actually quite thin, so I don't think

we gain that much by encapsulating it within its own component. The

shadow dom barries makes it considerably more difficult and we have to

hack around the inability to cross the boundaries ourselves (which

accounted for ~30% of the code in the search wrapper anyway).



This change moves the input into the main app component so that we can

utilize aria-roles and attributes to announce and bring focus to th

relevant elements.

entry.content:

since I switched to using LayoutUnit. However, there is a difference

entry.title: snap_groups: Refactor clamshell split view
entry.content:
This moves clamshell intermediate split view functionalities to

SplitViewOverviewSession. This will observe a window in intermediate

split view and decide when to start/end overview.



This will allow us to separate clamshell split view from

SplitViewController and initialize SplitViewOverviewSession directly

from SnapGroupController, and move/rename it easily.



Note that this still relies on SplitViewController to update

`divider_position_` for incoming bounds calculations and NotifyDividerPositionChanged() to update the overview bounds.



Also moves some APIs from SplitViewController and overview_test_util to

overview_utils.



Test: existing + modified

Bug: b/296246981

entry.title: Fix Windows OOP print cancel handling after PDF conversion failure
entry.content:
Correct job cancel handling for out-of-process printing after the

Windows conversion from PDF to target language fails. Since there can

be pending asynchronous commands, the PrintJobWorkerOop needs to more

closely track the cancel request and avoid sending any further data

to the Print Backend service.

entry.title: Change handling of AutogeneratedTheme and UsingDeviceTheme
entry.content:
AutogeneratedTheme is the old representation of theme colors. UsingDeviceTheme enables the browser to follow the OS colors. AutogeneratedTheme is represented as a CustomThemeSupplier. Fix

behavior where UsingDeviceTheme was true but the AutogeneratedTheme

was being used to style the browser.



The change in ThemeService fixes the return value of UsingDeviceTheme.

To fix the colors, without clearing the theme from prefs,

UsingDeviceTheme controls if we provide a null ThemeSupplier instead of

the configured one.

entry.title: [Nearby] Add third db to separate remote and local public credentials.
entry.content:
Nearby Presence has two types of public credentials: remote and local.

Because the db is only able to store fields provided in the proto

and the type of public credential is not a field in the Nearby protos,

a third database is added to separate the two types of public

credential (despite being the same proto). This allows for them to

be returned by public credential type when later retrieved.



Full design doc at go/cros-nearby-presence-credential-storage.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=Histograms superseded by two new histograms.

The previous histogram was not emitted to as this feature is still

under development.



Low-Coverage-Reason: Cannot test production constructor in test.

entry.title: Soften Viewport size DCHECK in XrWebglLayer
entry.content:
When Chrome is paused, particularly it seems on older devices, the GPU

process may be killed which results in a ContextLoss. This ContextLoss

can cause issues for inline sessions upon resuming Chrome, when they

attempt to update the size of the viewports, and the new size is 0

because this context has been lost. This change softens the DCHECK that

would previously occur into simply an early return and a log statement

if we received a zero-sized viewport without a context loss. In the

case of context loss, the session is theoretically recoverable if the

page was appropriately listening for the context loss event and provides

the session with a new base layer (though admittedly inline sessions are

rare enough and inline sessions who appropriately handle this case are

likely even rarer), so this was chosen over simply ending the session.

Until that time the session may try to function with the old viewport

sizes; however, since the context is lost it will be unlikely to

actually succesfully composite anything.



Fixed: 1474999

Change-Id: I575574098b096aa3ea06f451ad16402dc4fcdd6d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4824588

entry.title: Speculative fix for hung frames during cardboard startup
entry.content:
Sometimes during cardboard startup we will receive an unexpected frame.

I have not been able to track down the origins of this frame; but one

thing that I have seen is that it seems like we will get an early

"SubmitFrameMissing" that will clear the frame and then despite having

queued up a request for frame data, the data will not be sent back up.

Regardless of if this fixes the issue, we should probably ensure that

the frame loop keeps running even in the event of a SubmitFrameMissing,

so this CL does that (which I also hope will fix the occasional hang

I've seen), and adds a bit more logging around the frame submit and

checks that should help provide further debug data for this issue.



Bug: 1477016

Change-Id: I0fd429de3dde01766c8d26a4b5bfbf0dc826af20

entry.title: Revert "Toss stale a11y serializations that were sent by a renderer while the"
entry.content:
This reverts commit e63b2d3673aeab6fdf61af7a8d16f208d19862b9.



Reason for revert: This CL may be causing AccessibilityIpcErrorBrowserTest.ResetBrowserAccessibilityManager to fail on many bots.



Original change's description:

> Toss stale a11y serializations that were sent by a renderer while the

> browser was changing AXMode

>

> When the accessibility mode changes, the page is reset and then the

> entire page is re-sent from the root down (because the entire page is

> marked dirty).

>

> Any in flight serializations from right before the mode change was

> received are obsolete and should be thrown on the floor.

>

> Without this change, the obsolete serialization could be applied to a

> brand new AXTree that was recently created because of the mode change,

> and which doesn't have the nodes being referred to in the serialization,

> causing mysterious fatal errors in AXTree in the form, "Node X will not

> be in the tree and is not the new root".

>

> Bug: 1471373

> Change-Id: Ib15fec5355aee5fd515675a56034d5fb8e786c12

entry.title: Avoid O(n^2) in layout of many fragmentainers.
entry.content:
We only need to know the stitched LayoutBox size of all the fragments

combined when we're done with the last fragment, so avoid going through

every fragment for every fragment. We used to end up in

LayoutBox::ComputeSize() (which loops through every fragment) for every

fragment.



This improves perf_tests/layout/multicol/tall-content-short-columns.html

performance from 0.77 runs per second to 1.15 runs per second. That's

about 50% faster, which isn't a lot, but there are other O(n^2) issues

which play a bigger role here, especially during pre-paint. We don't

have a separate test for just layout, but that shouldn't be necessary,

either.



Bug: 1476776

Change-Id: Ie9ca7ea5b6decfd3c775217548bb4482bdb5cfec

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4821786

entry.title: Improve ash::ComboBox accessibility
entry.content:
Adds combobox a11y role, and sets relevant accessibility data

* the combobox value to match the combobox text,

* active descendant when the combobox menu is shown to the radio

button view currently selected in the menu

* menu expanded state

* Overrides RadioButton and RadioButtonGroup classes for combobox

options menu to tweak their accessibility data to better match usage

within combobox, where radio button visuals are used mainly as

indicators of menu selection state, and where pressing the button

selects/activates the combobox option (instead of toggling the

button).



Adds missing CheckedState change a11y notification to OptionButtonBase

when the button checked state changes.



While here, adds handling for TAB and ESCAPE keys when the combobox menu

is shown - tab now updates the selected option (instead of moving focus

from the combobox and closing the dropdown menu); escape resets

selection and closes the dropdown.



BUG=b:297025511



Change-Id: I485eeb8f63598c5c5652b22700f88ccdc9689d76

entry.title: Revert "content: unconditionally populate frame_url in ContextMenuParams"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 4f292f92e527173452a005bdc35df59faa78c4f3.



Reason for revert: Likely to be causing failures on MSan bots https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Tests and https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20MSan%20Tests



Original change's description:

> content: unconditionally populate frame_url in ContextMenuParams

>

> The prior design only populated frame_url when the initiating frame was

> a subframe, which led to code in quite a few places to use frame_url if

> present and page_url otherwise, or to test for an empty frame_url as a

> signal that the initiator was a subframe.

>

> This change makes frame_url unconditional, and adds a separate parameter

> for whether the initiator is a subframe. It also refactors

> TestRenderViewContextMenu slightly to make some of the factory arguments

> for that class optional, since nearly all call sites pass the same

> values.

>

> This is a preparatory refactor for a behavior change in passing invoker

> origins through the context menu.

>

entry.title: Improve SensorBackForwardCacheBrowserTest.SensorPausedWhileCached
entry.content:
- Fix some typos in the description, including the expected value when

navigating back to the a-page.

- Check for alpha=1 after navigating to the b-page. The existing

validateEvents() call did not specify an expected value so it was a

no-op.

- For the above to work consistently, change the sensor orientation data

before injecting the test JS code, otherwise there can be a race

condition in which the first orientation event is fired and registered

before the orientation data has been updated.

entry.title: [Floss] Restore previous Bluetooth adapter state on sign out
entry.content:
Previously, when a user signed out, the user preferences that specify

the desired Bluetooth adapter state would be applied before the adapter

object registered that the real adapter was powered on.



This change ensures the tracked adapter state is correct before user

preferences are applied.

entry.title: mojo: Make ServiceFactory::Add work on any T.
entry.content:
According to the ServiceFactory documentation, it expects:



std::unique_ptr(mojo::PendingReceiver)



where |T| is any type (generally an implementation of |Interface|).



However, that's not the case right now. It forces T to be a subclass of

Interface because ServiceFactory::InstanceHolder is generic over the

Interface type not T.



Change InstanceHolder to be generic over T (the Impl type) so that it

works for any T. This allows the real implementation of Interface to be

hidden as an implementation-detail.



Bug: b/293533558

Change-Id: I26d0e0c76cf6543531b2f8a4430fdbadfaab4782

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4819726

entry.title: [ImprovedDownloadWarnings] Make download item cards scale with viewport
entry.content:
This CL makes the width of the download item cards on chrome://downloads

scale better with the width of the viewport. Currently the cards are

constrained to 680px. After this CL, they will scale to 80% of the

viewport width, clamped between 550px and 960px. The min and max widths

were determined with the aim of consistency with similar pages like

chrome://history and chrome://bookmarks.



This change was requested by UX as part of improved download warnings,

a project aiming to make download UI surfaces more clear and consistent.



Screencasts:

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1HElIwqOtYD4zNriaq_RJnwh9puVX8--V

entry.title: Only block prefetches under a registered Service Worker's path
entry.content:
Currently, if we have a service worker registered for path

https://a.com/sw/, any prefetch with the same origin https://a.com will

fail even if the prefetch url doesn't fall under https://a.com/sw/.



Allow files in any paths under https://a.com with no registered service

worker to be prefetched even if https://a.com/sw/ has a service worker

registered.

entry.title: Reland "Run HangWatcher in zygote children"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 15b5ea3d27f335e48cadf72fc07dadbfcab7d470



This reland fixes the MSAN error with `thread_started_` in HangWatcher.



Original change's description:

> Run HangWatcher in zygote children

>

> On Linux and ChromeOS, the HangWatcher never runs in zygote children

> (renderers, gpu process, and some utility processes) because it's

> only called in ContentMainRunnerImpl::RunBrowser() and

> RunOtherNamedProcessTypeMain(), neither of which run in zygote children.

>

> It does get initialized on the main thread because that is run in

> ChromeMainDelegate::CommonEarlyInitialization(), which is called

> from RunZygote().

>

> The Linux sandbox cannot be started in a multithreaded process, so

> the children that need to apply a sandbox will only start the

> HangWatcher after applying the sandbox.

>

> Use of the HangWatcher in zygote children is gated by a new

> EnableHangWatcherInZygoteChildren base::Feature.

>

entry.title: [Omnibox] Truncate visible url
entry.content:
Navigations become too slow when the url displayed in the url bar is

very long, causing ANRs and jank. We only need to keep enough

characters to fill the url bar.
